results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Ross Campbell, Gerry Hudson and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film explores a wide variety of animals on display at the Melbourne Zoo. All the major different animal groups are represented and each animal is shown in a natural environment. Gives a close look to animals we would not normally see at close range.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Campbell, Gerry Hudson and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre

results.title: Zoo
results.creator_credit: Gerry Hudson, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: This film was made at the Melbourne Zoo and, without commentary, shows the activities - particularly eating - of birds in the air and animals on land and in water. There are some interesting close-ups of parts of animals, eg. the texture of the skin of a hippo and the back of an eagle.

results.title: Zonbi the doll
results.creator_credit: Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology and Cam Panlock
results.brief_description: This dark 2D animation features a battered little doll in a gloomy prison. When the lid to his box is opened, what happens to Zonbi? WARNING: Some scenes may disturb younger viewers

results.title: Zonation
results.creator_credit: H Scales and Sydney Scientific Film Society
results.brief_description: A group of university students study the zonation pattern of animals and plants on a marine rock platform, and the various physical and biological factors contributing to their distribution. At the highest tide level are blue periwinkles; then the barnacle zone, the worm zone and at low tide level, the cunjevoizone and then kelps. The ways in which various creatures protect themselves against dessication from sun and wind and against being washed off the rocks are shown.

results.title: Zoetrope
results.brief_description: Animation device called Zoetrope and assorted animation strips. Body of Zoetrope is a cylinder formation closed on bottom and open at top with a series of slits around top rim and painted green. Wood spindle joins cylinder to metal tiered stand. Zoetrope has five various themed printed paper animation strips depicting illustrations of a sequence of drawings showing motion. Animation strips are either black and white or mono coloured with an animation on both sides.

results.title: Zlateh the Goat
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Winter is late so for Reuven the furrier it is a bad year. After long hesitation he decides to sell Zlateh the goat. However, the pet goat is spared from the butcher’s knife when she saves her young master from a snowstorm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios

results.title: Ziegfeld Follies
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: In a brief introductory passage, the now-dead showman, Ziegfield (William Powell), reminisces over his past triumphs (very well depicted with puppets). He then plans, from Heaven, a new “Follies”. The elaborate acts of his vision follow, with Fred Astaire, Lucille Bremer, Lucille Ball, Lena Horne, Gene Kelly, Esther Williams, Judy Garland and Kathryn Grayson. Interspersed are three good comedy routines featuring Victor Moore, Ed Arnold, Fanny Brice, Hume Cronin and Red Skelton.

results.title: Zero, the troublemaker
results.brief_description: Uses animated numerals to show the role of zero in addition and subtraction, and its special use as a place holder for other numerals. Indicates how useful zero can be in both small and large numbers. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description: Uses animated numerals to show the role of zero in addition and subtraction, and its special use as a place holder for other numerals. Indicates how useful zero can be in both small and large numbers. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Zero patience
results.creator_credit: John Greyson, Anna Stratton, Louise Garfield and Zero Patience Productions
results.brief_description: John Greyson’s Zero Patience takes as its premise, the very serious subject of the history and politics of the AIDS virus and turns it into an offbeat hybrid of the Hollywood musical. Referencing and connecting unlikely subjects like French philosopher Michel Foucault, Busby Berkeley musicals and the history of contagious diseases. The films playful lack of respect for historical figures and its fairly decent musical numbers are some of its many pleasures. (Not to mention singing sphincters and a drag queen HIV virus!) Set in present day Toronto, Zero Patience has famous sexologist and explorer Sir Richard Francis Burton (John Robinson), still alive due to his discovery of the fountain of youth and working as chief taxidermist for the Natural History Museum. His current project, a retrospective of famous diseases of the ages. Enter patient zero (Normand Fauteux), the ghost of the Canadian flight attendant believed to be the first reported AIDS fatality, who has come back from the dead to clear his name and set the record straight.

results.title: Zero Kelvin = Kjaerlighetens Kjotere [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Hans Moland, Esben Hoilund Carlsen, Bent Rognlien, Sandrew-Baumanfilm AB and Norsk Film
results.brief_description: A chilling psychological thriller set in the stark wilderness of an arctic winter and a central plot which revolves around three men with very different personalities and what happens when they are thrown together in claustrophobic conditions in a harsh sub-zero environment with no escape for several months. Henrik Larsen (Gard B. Eidsvold) is a sensitive young poet who naively decides to leave the safety of Oslo and his girlfriend Gertrude (Camilla Martens) to embark on a fur-trapping expedition to Greenland for twelve months. It is the year 1925. On arrival at the east coast of Greenland, Henrik is teamed up with two experienced trappers, the rough and intimidating Randbek (Stellan Skarsgard) and the quieter introspective scientist, Holm (Bjorn Sundquist). Their living quarters for the twelve months is a tiny isolated hut in the bleak icy sparseness of the Greenland wastelands where tension and conflict between the three escalates to unimaginable heights, and man’s inhumanity to man emerges as more than just a threat. This is an outstanding film by Norwegian director Hans Petter Moland (The Last lieutenant) full of atmosphere and ambience and a stark beauty which underlies the ugliness and volatility smouldering beneath the surface. Stellan Skarsgard (The Unbearable lightness of being, The Hunt for Red October, Breaking the Waves, Simple minded murderer) and Gard B. Eidsvold (The Last lieutenant) each bring to their role a passionate intensity and a chilling reality of the human condition in adverse circumstances. The landscape is truly atmospheric and captured beautifully by cinematographer Philip Ogaard. Adapted from the novel by Danish author Peter Tutein. (Awards: Sans Sebastian (1995); Rouen (1996); Norway (1996)) In Norwegian with English subtitles.
